alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 29 at 6:00AM AKST until December 30 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow, blowing snow, freezing rain, and strong winds occuring. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Power lines could be damaged and trees blown over. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches are expected. Freezing rain with less than one tenth of an inch accumulation expected south of Fox this morning. West winds gusting 40 to 50 mph expected through Wednesday afternoon. * WHERE...Middle Tanana Valley. * WHEN...Now through 6 AM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and light freezing rain will continue early this morning. Heavier snow will develop by mid morning and continue into this afternoon. West winds gusting 40 to 50 mph are expected through this afternoon which will cause blowing snow with brief blizzard conditions. Power lines could be damaged and trees blown over by the strong winds. The strongest winds are expected this morning through afternoon. Winds should diminish by late afternoon, with light snow continuing into Thursday. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet and ice are occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible. Strong winds are also possible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
